description: From Ancient Greek ἐπιγραφή (epigraphḗ, “inscription”), from ἐπιγράφω (epigráphō, “write upon”), from ἐπῐ- (epi-, “on, upon, over, etc.”) +‎ γρᾰ́φω (gráphō, “to draw, paint, write, etc.”).

entries.meaning: An inscription, especially on a building.
A literary quotation placed at the beginning of a book or other text.
(mathematics, of a function) The set of all points lying on or above the function's graph.

verbs.description: epigraph (third-person singular simple present epigraphs, present participle epigraphing, simple past and past participle epigraphed)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To provide (a literary work) with an epigraph.
